review_title: Necessary but needing a major update.
one_reviews_text:
I need this application
but its got such a terrible interface
I don't find it intuitive, and it won't let you browse other folders, just the one folder it makes in My Pictures.
I have hundreds of 360's I need to browse to check out
it is the simplest and fastest way once you get all your stuff in the folder.
Other apps are kind of a pain 
simple next previous 360 image with left stick
plays standard mp4 and mov h264 360 vids
sometimes just flakes out and disappears for no reason
Its the fastest way to browse a folder but the opening menu needs some user interface upgrading.
would be nice if it would view glb files like the home environments.
no bight/contrast/sat that I could see
but it works

review_title: nul !!! appli lancée, rien ne se passe!!
one_reviews_text: NULL
It used to work, now it doesn't.  In fact, the entire Oculus Library is broken in the VR view (in a CV1) as of the V 31 update.
How does this not use the touch controllers? How has this not been updated and why is it here? Why does it require my photos to be in a specifically named folder on my C drive?

Not intuitive at all, unable to browse for photos, have had to create a copy in a dedicated OneDrive folder. App doesnt close properly, just hangs with a spinning circle on the Oculus launcher app. Sometimes arrow keys let me move from photo to photo, sometimes they dont etc Avoid and use something from Steam instead.
The fact that they will neither update nor pull this app is disconcerting at the least. If they care this little about their own apps then are they to be trusted with an entire platform?

Facebook is no useful VR platform without a working 360 photo viewer. And this one does not work. 

After 7 years with Oculus I will soon switch to HTC. 

Bye, bye Facebook VR!
Couldn't connect to Oculus 360 photos, application keeps throwing this error message. Not usable.

review_title: Used to be a great app, now a mess.
one_reviews_text: I spent most of my time on this app when I had my Gear VR back then and I absolutely loved it. The ability to view pictures from 360 cities and so on was so good. Now on Rift S, you can't do none of that and the controls are broken. You have to use a keyboard or an Xbox controller to navigate. Hope they fix it soon as it's a shame that this app isn't working. Wish there was a way to browse 360 cities from my headset.
app dont stop when its closed. No have setting for disable slideshow
how does one go about uploading photos to this application?  I see the featured photos. How do I upload so it can be viewed as well
Easy flip through your images with the left controller. Improvement possible on all other controls though. Scaling works well too (images taken with phone and cardboardcamera app)

The app does not load (blue loading icon), then the app does not shut down unless I restart the computer or reboot oculus. 
A bit disappointing as we bought the headset to view our 360 architectural renders. Hoping it can be fixed.

Why is there no support for square pictures? For example 4000 x 4000 are not displayed! Can you fix it?
Very inconvenient control and only one button works. The slide show automatically turns on. No zoom.
Great quality

You need to move your head to position a little blue dot over your selection, then use the enter key on your keyboard to select. Hit escape to exit.  Do this a few times and it simply stops responding. Want to view your own images? You need to copy them yo the pictures folder on your system. This is incredibly stupid. My photos are organized by subject and location and average 100 meg each. I'm expected to copy them all to one folder and waste a ton of space on my system drive?

There's also no way to visit other sites with collections of 360 photos. 360Cities? Can't look at the content there. A shame since I have a hundred images on the site.
İ have panaromic pictures from lumion software. This app not working
ghdfhfdsh
Please fix this app..
All of my favorites have vanished, as well as any photo that isn't "Facebook Featured". What happened?

This app is actual really nice and a good experience, but a not that long ago nearly all the categories that it used to have in its menu have disappeared. While checking for a reason for this I saw that it was fine on the oculus go so it seems its limited on rift. Something could be preventing the Rift version from talking to 360cities.net. But till this issue is fixed there isn't  a reason to return to this app.

This app used to be good when i first downloaded it. Now there is no longer 3D 360 photos. Pics used to be organized, well not anymore. Also as well there was more photo choices but now you only get about 100 photos where before it was 10 TIMES THAT AMOUNT!!!!!!!!!!!!
It launches, but you have NO way to interact! It doesnt recognize the native Oculus controllers (yes they work, both checked in another app and restarted).

review_title: Update the app and fix the issues!
one_reviews_text:
Why don't you update this app? It has a lot of potential. First of all, please add a search bar or a filter with some selections, like a sort by new photos, city, ect. Everytime I try to take a look at Japan, for example, I need 15 mins to reach the end, where I can finally find something new.
On top of this, I cannot see my favorites pictures. I see only the thumbnails totally grey. If I try to open one of those, it doesn't appear anything, only the name of the picture (while the loading bar reach the end). I have this problem since one year... please fix it!

DECEMBER 2018 UPDATE: all the pictures taken from 360cities.net (the 99% of the contents) are now DISAPPEARED! Everyone with the RIFT (not the GO) have the same issue. 1 Star...

Nice app, although a bit outdated. Controls cound be improved. 
The biggest issue is content. Most is focused on being 360, but NO DEPTH! Even simple Google Cardboard Camera app makes 3D 360 photos. Ansel also makes 3D 360 screenshots.
wont let me select anything in the intro menu.. cant do anything in the app.. then when I close it I get a popup saying it failed to close.
Great idea but lack of control of any function makes it not worth the use.
I am forced to store my photos in one directory. If an app can't let you select a location then it is useless.
There are lots of photos, with different types.
That's good app
nice

first，the content is  very old,
second, not support to view mpo files
Good

First category is Olympic photos from 2 years ago.  2nd category is random list of stuff from Facebook that doesn't appear to be maintained.  3rd category is the only thing that seems to be updated, but a weekly destination feed hardly carries the app.  It's a tremendous disapointment for anyone expecting this to be a content destination.
it throws error every time i want to see my photos
Enjoyed
Nice
good

Opens to a main menu and thumbnails of "Featured Photos"... touch controllers cannot select anything on the page.  Nor does looking at an item and leaving the cursor on it for a bit.  Have to dig up XInput device to be able to use it at all?  Cursor can lose its alignment, causing app to select items which are not the ones the blue cursor is hovering over.  Only lets you view your own photos if you put them in Pictures\OculusPhotos\ folder.  Feels like an old, buggy app intended to demo VR systems, that was abandoned by the developers long ago.  If all you want is to view your 360 photos, this can technically do it, but be ready for frustration and the need to jump through a bunch of hoops.
2 years and they haven't fixed this. Amazing.
The go-to app for viewing 360 photos. Sets the standard. I definitely don't have anything bad to say about it.
test
I was able to view my 360-stereo supersampled screenshots taken from Nvidia Ansel. Witcher 3 looks really cool in VR!
sdvdbvdfv

That the same app that targets kids with Christmas, Santa and Hogwarts offers an exciting trip to Mr. Grey's bedroom, um, who thought that was a good idea and what is the app for, exactly? As an adult I don't care what you view, but have a little class. Also, photogs need to learn to use tripods and a lot of the content is just filler. Forget using Touch, remote and gamepad only, and did I mention you can't save anything? Also judders, has a whimsical sense of what size human beings should be in relation to the real world and we could go on all night about having to go through all the boring filler to get back to the gems. The worst insult though has to be the grainy Dr. Who photo. Seriously?
I especially enjoy the 3D art and the contest winner section. Some excellent and some meh meh photos.
Just finished installation, and it couldn't even load the screen. Poped up a typical windows error dialog box. "Oculus360Photos.exe 1.28.0.326767 TCID:1663585 has stopped working."

I really liked this, you can take 3d stereoscopic panorama images with your phone with the cardboard camera app and then view them in this app on the CV1 instead of the crappy google cardboard. Highly recommend for this alone.
This app needs some serious improvement. First of all, FB photos can't even be bookmarked, and the rest that isn't FB photos is low resolution pictures, all from the same site.
Needs touch support, and the ability to browse to a folder.
It claims to support 1.14's new Touch-as-gamepad feature, but does not seem to actually do so.

Some photos are a lot better than others. The technology needs to advance both on the camera end and on the HMD end for this to really be stunning. The 3D artwork tends to be cooler than the photos, but some of the 3D artwork has wacked out IPD settings.
Awesome app to view my 360 photos! Would love to see Touch support soon!

Why in such advanced technologies, developers don't try a bit harder on delivering a better user experience?
Why do the 360 photos always show the annoying name and author?
Why does the photo change after a few seconds?
Why don't you have settings to control these things?
I need to review over one hundred 360 images, and I am wasting time, and have a headache because of these oversights...
So... it could have been good...

360 photos holds some great views of some beautiful world locations. Biggest drawback is that, taken with 2-D cameras, they are not stereoscopically three-dimensional (but the advantage is that more people can share their photography). Another drawback is that some of the user submitted photos are not even full 360 degrees--there should be a way to weed those out. The computer generated 3D artwork section, however, is great! This app is a cheap way to travel both to real-life and otherworldly environments. I was offended, however, by the blatant partisanship displayed in some of the 360 photos, namely of the March on Washington and the one in London (from the Huffington Compost), but no 360 views of the 2017 Presidential Inauguration. The London march displayed an offensive sign calling the current president a "vulgar pig." Can anyone imagine such grossly insulting treatement of the former president being allowed on here? Put your vulgar partisanship aside, Oculus/Facebook, and stop offending half your customers.

This absolutely needs touch support. Nearly half a year later and no touch support? I have many 360 photos and videos I would like to watch in here and don't like to have touch+controller+remote all on my desk. Touch should work with all Oculus apps.

I feel like this is one of the more underrated experiences in Oculus. Sure, still pics in a real world setting don't hold a candle to video, but in terms of VR experiences, the resolution of a 360 degree photograph is, at the moment, superior to video. 

I see people talking about the nostalgia and joy they get from Google Earth VR, but for me, Photos was a wonderful walk down memory lane. Being able to see, again, places I've travelled or ever being able to check out hotels or destinations I want to see or may see in the future. The photos that were shot professionally are so well done, you do feel at least a small amount of presence, and I thoroughly enjoyed the VR Artist submissions. I hope they will do more contests in the future.

All of that said, I do have a couple of problems with the app. First and foremost, it needs a robust search function. I appreciate the work put into user submissions, but the quality, and many times the subject of photos hold no interest for me. It becomes tedious trying to sort through user submitted photos to find gems that were shot professionally. Secondly, and not necessarily as important, it needs touch support. I know it seems silly, and I'm spoiled Touch user who "Rifted" for the first time (actually used VR for the first time) with the Touch. Life is so much easier when you don't have to drop your Touch and fumble around for the remote when switching between apps.

All in all, it's a good App and it deserves, imo, slightly more than the 3.5 stars it currently has. But so much of VR is about what you want to get out of the experience. If you're interested in seeing the world in the comfort of your home withouth the joys of the cultural experiences, this a good option.
